title: Nike Colin Kaepernick Campaign
summary: How Nike's bold 'Believe in Something' campaign sparked controversy but reinforced brand values.
content:
Case Study: Nike Kaepernick

In 2018, Nike featured Colin Kaepernick — the NFL quarterback who kneeled during the national anthem to protest police brutality — in its 'Just Do It' anniversary campaign.

Strategic Rationale

Nike's PR and marketing teams calculated that their core audience skewed younger and aligned with social justice values. The bold move was a calculated risk that prioritised long-term brand equity over short-term controversy.

Results

Nike's stock initially dipped but recovered rapidly. Online sales surged 31% in the days following the announcement. The campaign won numerous advertising and PR awards.

Key Learnings

Purpose-driven PR requires alignment between brand values and campaign messaging. Controversy can be a strategic tool when it reflects genuine brand beliefs.
